VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {1.00}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Air and Labor or the cell corresponding to Air and Speed?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Air} and {Speed} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Planning and Sustainability or the cell corresponding to Planning and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Planning} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Maritime and Efficiency or the cell corresponding to Planning and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Planning} and {Sustainability} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.09 to 0.17?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Intermodal, Compliance), (Maritime, Compliance), (Air, Cost), (Maritime, Cost), (Intermodal, Efficiency), (Last Mile, Efficiency), (Maritime, Efficiency), (Intermodal, Labor), (Last Mile, Labor)}.
